result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:36 PM
Interm Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Isabel M Rodriguez Rios.  
Defendant Isabel M Rodriguez Rios in court. 
Attorney Gutierrez requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Case called at 9:50 a.m.
State appeared in court by Assistant District Attorney Kristi Gordon.
Attorney Luis Gutierrez in court for Isabel M. Rodriguez Rios.
Isabel M. Rodrigues Rios did not appear.
State requests that a Capias be issued and bail be revoked and forfeited.
Court will issue a Capias, but STAY it until the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:43 AM   File not called on the record.
Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Isabel M Rodriguez Rios in court by zoom with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Gutierrez requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Walmart/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:49 AM Defendant Isabel M Rodriguez Rios in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
